title: One Person Company (OPC) Registration in India
tagline: Start your company as a solo founder with limited liability protection.
highlights: Easy conversion to Private Limited Company

sections.heading: What is an OPC?
content: A One Person Company (OPC) is a business structure that allows a single entrepreneur to operate a company with limited liability.
It combines the advantages of a Private Limited Company with complete ownership and control by one person.

sections.heading: Key Benefits of OPC
list: Limited liability – personal assets remain protected
Separate legal entity – company can own property and enter contracts
Higher credibility compared to sole proprietorship
Full control with a single owner
Easy conversion into a Private Limited Company

sections.heading: OPC Registration Requirements
list: Must be an Indian citizen and resident
Only one shareholder and one director allowed

sections.heading: OPC Registration Process
list: Issuance of Certificate of Incorporation along with PAN and TAN

sections.heading: Time Required for OPC Registration
content: The OPC registration process usually takes 7 to 12 working days, subject to MCA approval.

sections.heading: Comparison: OPC vs Private Limited vs LLP
Frequently Asked Questions
list: Is nominee mandatory for OPC? Yes, nominee appointment is compulsory under Companies Act.
Is GST registration required for OPC? Only if turnover crosses the threshold or business requires it.
Can OPC be converted to Private Limited Company? Yes, conversion is allowed when turnover or capital exceeds limits.
Is audit mandatory for OPC? Yes, audit is mandatory regardless of turnover.
Can a foreigner register OPC? No, only Indian residents and citizens can incorporate OPC.
How is OPC different from proprietorship? OPC has limited liability and separate legal identity, unlike proprietorship.
